properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-21T04:59:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-20T12:59:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1933243898.2019
Area: Haida Gwaii, North Coast - inland including Stewart
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:08 a.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from 30 kilometres north of Seine River Village to 15 kilometres east of Sandpoint Island Provincial Park, moving east at 80 km/h. Locations impacted include: Mine Centre, Seine River Village and Flanders. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-08-20T13:34:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-20T11:09:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2074817562.2019
Area: Seine River Village - Mine Centre
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable overnight and early this morning for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts up to 90 km/h and up to 3 cm hail. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-08-20T16:24:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-20T08:34:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0422787402.2019
Area: Sioux Narrows - Nestor Falls - Morson, Fort Frances - Emo - Rainy River, Seine River Village - Mine Centre
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, heavy at times is expected. Heavy rain continues to fall over Arviat but is expected to taper off this morning. A slow moving low pressure system over Hudson Bay continues to bring heavy rain and moderate easterly winds to southern Kivalliq. As of 3:00 am this morning a total of 39 mm of rain had fallen over the community and a further 2 to 5 mm is likely before tapering off this morning. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-20T18:59:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-20T08:17:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3896373670.2019
Area: Arviat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. Rain will continue today as a trough of low pressure remains over Haida Gwaii. Total rainfall amounts up to 60 mm can be expected by this evening before the rain eases. Additionally, southeast winds of 70 to 90 km/h will develop this afternoon. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-21T03:43:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-20T11:44:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0390708072.2019
Area: Haida Gwaii
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. A low pressure system tracking through northern North Dakota is expected to trigger scattered thunderstorms late this evening and overnight into Tuesday morning. Some of these thunderstorms may reach severe thresholds. The cluster of thunderstorms will exit the province early Tuesday morning. This severe thunderstorm watch may be expanded to include a larger portion of southern Manitoba as the evening progresses and the event unfolds. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-20T13:30:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-20T01:31:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2836843370.2019

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots. Thunderstorms will move into the region overnight and early in the morning. These thunderstorms could also produce up to 3 cm hail. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Fog will continue until clearing late this morning. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
